column4: So I feel really dumb, but how do I get my driver to recognize my wireless connection
my driver is installed and active and everything...it just won't recognize my router
does iwconfig show a wlan connection
could you paste the iwconfig output pls?
IEEE 802.11bg  ESSID:off/any             Mode:Managed  Access Point: Not-Associated   Tx-Power=0 dBm              Retry  long limit:7   RTS thr:off   Fragment thr:off           Power Management:off
PorkusMcG , it looks like his router ESSID isn't being picked up by the nm
have you configured your network manager ?
alt +f2 , network-manager-gnome, then look at your options to connect
showing that there is no such directory or file
look in applications / network /for network manager
i don't have a networks in my applications menu
IEEE 802.11bg  ESSID:off/any             Mode:Managed  Access Point: Not-Associated   Tx-Power=0 dBm              Retry  long limit:7   RTS thr:off   Fragment thr:off           Power Management:off
*** network-manager-gnome is already the newest version. 0 upgraded, 0 newly installed, 0 to remove and 0 not upgraded.
